idevices.content:
Creyoco is a learning module editor for arranging different types of teaching and learning content (text, pictures, data for download, audio and video material etc.) as autonomous module. Besides the simple creation of learning modules and websites, interactive elements like exercises for self-testing purpose can be embedded into the content.

Learning modules and websites are created easily in a short time and automatically get navigation placed on the left side. The contents of modules can be used with different layouts in different contexts. Afterwards the learning modules can be used in various output formats: The learning module can be offered on a website or be embedded in a learning platform and made available thereby.

The SCORM standard is able to send the page views and the e-test results to a learning platform, if needed; the users data can be tracked from there.

Creyoco can be used for free on www.creyoco.de.

If necessary, the software can be downloaded and run on a private server (open source).

Creyoco: General Characteristics

  • Separation of layout and content by „styles“
  • Hierarchical structure: Unlimited number of layers
  • Didactical tools like previous knowledge
  • Interactive learning elements: Test questions (multiple choice, cloze tests), reflection
  • Workshop instructions, password-protected text
  • Text editor with integration of media

Background information on Creyoco

  • Developed in the Media Center of the TUM
  • Advancement of the editor „eXe-Learning“
  • Web-based and independent of the operating system

children.title: 1.1 DEVELOPMENT OF LEARNING MODULES AND WEBSITES

idevices.content:
In the context of university courses there are different areas of application.
A selection of options:

Before the course

Creating grading tests

  • Before the first lecture
  • Assessing the preexisting knowledge

Providing information about the course

  • Content overview of prior knowledge
  • Sources with hyperlinks
  • Embedded Wikipedia articles

Introduction to the seminar

  • Additional material is provided by the lecturers
  • Flipped Classroom – preparation

During the lecture

Dealing with topics

  • Background knowledge / content-related additions in specific subjects
  • Embedding Wikis on relevant topics
  • Material can be used independently by the learners

Exercises and homework

  • Intermediate tests can be done by the learners to query their knowledge
  • Case studies can be presented in Creyoco

After the course

  • Contents of the learners can be added to supplement present Creyoco learning modules
  • Embedding in the learning platform as a standardised learning module

In order to create learning modules with creyoco, please open www.creyoco.de . Creyoco is web-based and can be used directly in the web browser. No installation of a program is necessary. This ensures an access of creyoco, independent of the location and the operating system, as long as you are connected to the Internet.

At the beginning it is necessary to register as a user in Creyoco. Thus, a personal account is generated for you. With your login information, you can access your learning modules at any time.

Registration

To register on www.creyoco.de : Enter a user name, a valid e-mail address and password in the online form and confirm your entries by clicking on „Create account“.

Your account will be created. Click on the link „Go to profile“ to go directly to your account.

Note: If the error message „Bitte geben Sie einen Benutzernamen an“ appears next to the field of the user name, this username is already taken. Try a different username in this case.

Login

If you are already registered, you can sign in to www.creyoco.de by entering your user name and the according password and clicking on „Login“.

A successful login takes you to the learning module overview of your account.

Logout

Click on the „Logout“ link at the top on the right to log out.

A multimedia-based learning module is a didactically structured tutorial. The content can be displayed through texts, hyperlinks, pictures, graphics, data files for download, audio, video etc. You can create interactive education modules by integrating applets and exercises (multiple choice questions, cloze tests, reflective tasks). Simple creation of modules is possible with the module editor.

What is a learning module editor?

„Editor tools serve for the creation of multimedia-based learning sequences and presentations with a programming knowledge as little as possible and facilitate the creation of e-learning media for a wide group of users.“

( Loos/Zimmermann/Chikova 2008 )

Characteristics of the education module editor

Simple, intuitive operation without programming knowledge
Authors without any knowledge of programming language or scripting language can easily create a learning module.

Creation of structured learning content
The available functionalities serve the didactical preparation of the course content.

Modular design
The author of the education module can choose between a variety of tools (text processing, integration of pictures etc.) and also combine them.

Unrelated learning modules
The learning module is not enclosed to a platform and therefore both usable as website and can be embedded into a platform.

( Vgl. Nieweler 2006, Roche 2007 )

After logging in, you can see your course overview, where the learning modules are listed.

You can create new courses and administer existing modules.

User interface of a learning module

To edit a learning module, click on the name of the course in the course overview. Then the screen is optically divided into three sections:

On the left side the navigation of the learning module is displayed. You can add pages, remove pages, rename pages and duplicate pages.

On the right side the „instructional devices“ (iDevices) are listed. iDevices are structural templates for each page.

The editing of the content is done in the main area in the middle of the page. Here you can switch between the following four areas:

Edit content Content editing and pasting iDevices
Choose layout Choosing the layout
Download package Export of the learning module
Metadata Additional information on the learning module

To switch to another module or to course overview, click on the title of the open course at the top on the right. You can select the desired module in the drop-down menu (the course overview is listed at the bottom by default).

children.title: 2.1 HOW DO I CREATE A LEARNING MODULE?

idevices.content: You can create and manage new learning modules in the course overview.

Managing learning modules at a glance

CREATE
Enter the name of your learning module and confirm with “OK”. The new module is added to the list of course overview.
IMPORT
Select the course file and click “Upload”.
SELECTION
Click in the square next to the learning module.
REMOVE
To delete a learning module, it must be selected.
DUPLICATE
To double learning modules, they must be selected.

Meaning of icons in the learning modules

Next to each learning module in the course overview there are other useful symbols:

PREVIEW
It opens a preview of the learning module in the browser.

The button has no effect, it has not been implemented yet.

EXPORT
Select the file format for the course export. At your disposal are IMS package, Common Cartridge, SCORM 2004, SCORM 1.2 and website.

The button has no effect, it has not been implemented yet.

children.title: 2.2 THE USER INTERFACE OF CREYOCO AT A GLANCE

idevices.content: At Creyoco the navigation of your learning module is located in the left column. By default, the item “Home” is available.

Control panels of navigation at a glance

ADD PAGE
Enter a name for your new page and click on “Create”. A new navigation point is created.
REMOVE PAGE
The currently selected page is deleted. Deletion must be confirmed with “Yes”.
RENAME PAGE
The name of the currently selected page can be changed. Confirm the new name of the page with the return key.
DUPLICATE PAGE
The selected page is doubled.
MORE...
A second line with local panels for navigation is displayed or hidden.
DEMOTE PAGE
The selected page is indented one level.
PROMOTE PAGE
The selected page is moved up one level to the left.
MOVE UP
The selected page is moved upwards within a level.
MOVE DOWN
The selected page is moved down within a level.

Texts, web sites, tests etc. can be inserted in pre-fabricated structures with the help of iDevices. The iDevices are in the right column and are structured by topics.

To insert an iDevice into a page, you select the required template by clicking

iDevices – overview

Content

Activity Text content with a headline
Free Text Text content
Glossary Two input fields with a headline for each entry: title and definition
Pdf iDevice PDF file with page selection
Protected Free Text password-protected text content
Reading Activity Three input fields with a headline: reading text, activity and feedback
Table of Content Inserting the navigation as a table of contents
Wiki Article Inserting Wikipedia articles

Didactics

Objectives Text content with a headline
Preknowledge Text content with a headline
Remark Text content with a headline

Communication

Feedback Provide an email address to which the learners can send feedback.
RSS Inserting RSS

Test

Case Study
Three input fields with a headline: reading text, activity and feedback
Cloze
Three input fields with heading: description, cloze test und feedback
For cloze: To insert a gap, highlight the relevant text and underline it.
Multiple Choice Headline and the box for the question; now feedback can be given to each possible answer.
Multiple choice questions can be made with both multiple correct answers and only one correct answer.
Reflection Two input fields with a headline: activity and answer

Media

External Web Site Integrating an external webpage that is displayed in the learning module.
Java Applet iDevice Integrating a Java applet

The following two steps are required to export learning modules:
1) Choosing a layout
2) Export of the learning module

1) Choosing a layout

Click on the link “Choose layout” in the menu. There are two different layout options available. Each layout on the right represents a responsive website, i.e. the website adapts optically to the size of the respective terminal screen.

Click on the desired layout. This will open a preview of the page. You can close the preview window by clicking on the cross icon on the top right.

Note: Not all features are displayed correctly in the preview. Therefore, you should check your learning modules later in the exported version.

2) Export of the learning module

Click on the link “Download package” in the menu. Creyoco offers different export options: IMS Package, Common Cartridge, SCORM 2004, SCORM 1.2 and website (zip).

The learning module is exported with the layout that you selected in the last step.

Export as web page

If you want to publish your learning module directly on the Internet in the form of a website, choose the export option “website (zip)”. In this case creyoco produces an HTML-based Web page with a front page “index.html” with your learning module. If you copy the entire contents of the folder and upload them on a web server, you can launch the finished website immediately.

To create a learning module (also a website) with creyoco the following basic steps are recommended:

1)   Create new learning module

A new learning module is created in the course overview.

2)   Creating a structure (navigation) for the learning module

You can add pages, remove pages, rename pages and duplicate pages. The sites can be moved up or down and the level of detail of the pages can be changed in the navigation.

3)   Pasting content using the instructional Devices (iDevices)

Texts, web sites, tests etc. can be inserted in pre-fabricated structures by iDevices. The iDevices are structured into topics.

4)   Choosing a layout

There are two different layouts to choose from. For each layout a version with responsive web design is available.

5)   Export of the learning module

For the publication as a web page or in a learning platform the learning module can be exported as website (Zip), IMS Package, Common Cartridge, SCORM 2004 and SCORM 1.2.

children.title: 2. CREATION OF LEARNING MODULES WITH CREYOCO

idevices.content: Welcome to our help- and support pages
